msItem.note: Blank except for Hearne's notes and pressmarks. Fol. 1r: ‘Suum cuique Tho: Hearne’, ‘E. Pr. 184’, ‘MS. 93’. Fol. 76v: ‘Things relating to Hereford’.

history.provenance: Hereford Cathedral. Many items are clearly strays from series now in Hereford Cathedral Library and Archives, formerly in the National Library of Wales, and calendared in National Register of Archives NRA 6186; most items relate to the Dean and Chapter estates, although part 29 concerns the bishop's estates. The separation may have occurred while the dean and chapter archives were in London between 1649 and 1661 (B. Smith in Hereford Cathedral: A History, ed. Gerald Aylmer and John Tiller (2000), p. 548).]

Thomas Hearne, presumably acquired between 1677 (date of part 27) and 1709. Parts 1–29 are catalogued as such under MS. 93 in Hearne's catalogue of 1709 (MS. Rawl. D. 1168, pp. 143–146). The contents of a companion volume of Hereford documents, Hearne's MS. 92, cannot all be traced, but most items are identifiable in Bodleian Library, MSS. Ch. Heref. and MSS. Rolls Heref. Part 30 perhaps acquired by Hearne after 1709, if it is part of his collection and not a later addition.
James Bellamy (1819–1909), President of St John's College, Oxford; found among his books after his death (R. L. Poole in English Historical Review 28/111 (1913) p. 446)
history.acquisition: Donated in November 1916 by the President and Fellows of St. John's College (note in the Bodleian library handlist, p. 214). Given the Summary Catalogue number 37443, now superseded (note by Richard Hunt in his copy of S.C. III.423). Formerly MS. Rawl. Q. b. 8.

recordHist.source: Summary description by Matthew Holford, December 2018.

msItem.title: Manorial court rolls for Marden, Clehonger and Eggleton, 1325–6 (fols. 5r, 6r, 7r) and 1347–8 (fols. 7r-v).

msItem.note: Bailiff's petition for allowances to the dean and chapter, 1351–2 ('anno 25')
Notes of arrears, A.D. 1349–51

supportDesc.extent:
3 membranes and attached schedule; formerly a roll 260–645 210–215 (roll)
185 80 (schedule)

msItem.title: Obligation, 1536
msItem.note: Obligation by James Hyett to the Dean and Chapter of Hereford in 40 marks.

msItem.title: Indentured lease, 1536
msItem.note: Lease by the Dean and Chapter of Hereford, to James Hyett of Lydney, gentleman, of the parsonage of Lydney and the chapel of St Briavels, as lately held by Richard a Courte.
Dorse blank except for endorsements.

msItem.title: Bailiff's account for the manor of Eggleton, Michaelmas 1416 - Michaelmas 1417
msItem.note: Dorse blank except for rubric.

msItem.title: Court roll of the manor of Eggleton, 23 May 1543
msItem.note: Dorse (fols. 11v, 12v) blank, except for contemporary notes on fol. 12v.

supportDesc.extent: 2 folios, probably from a codex rather than a roll 430 150

msItem.title: Proceedings relating to an accusation against the residentiary canons of Hereford, for detaining 'nocturnam distributionem' from mr. Richard Vaughan, 23 March 1608/9
msItem.note: Fol. 14r-v blank.

msItem.title: Letters patent of Elizabeth I to the Dean and Chapter of Hereford, 12 Nov. 1571
msItem.note: Inspeximus of a judgement in the Exchequer (Memoranda Roll, 12 Eliz. I, Hilary, Recorda) regarding the Dean and Chapter's rights to the goods of William Mason of Canon Pyon, felon.
(No enrollment found.)
Seal formerly attached with black and white cords; now removed and kept as MS. Ch. London 362*.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initial E: penwork drawing of Elizabeth, enthroned, with orb and sceptre. (No close resemblance to any of the images reproduced in E. Auerback, Tudor Artists (1954), pp. 34–46; cf. the image on the 1561 charter to Kingston upon Thames Grammar School.)
Penwork border at top with floral motifs, lion, rose, dragon, fleur-de-lis, and harp.
Decorative strapwork initials on the top line.

history.provenance: Dorse: ‘old writings of Hereford 3d bundle’; one other illegible endorsement.

msItem.rubric: 28 Sept. 1633. At ye Election of William Juxon Bishopp of London
msItem.note: A list of prebendaries and officers of St Paul's Cathedral, London
Included are the prebendaries and the archdeacons of London, Middlesex, Essex, Colchester and (apparently added later) St Albans.
Marginal annotations relating to payment of a subsidy and dates from Maundy Thursday to Simon and Jude's day.
Dorse, blank except for endorsements including: paules deanery and theyr prebendaryes and theyr times to preach.

msItem.title: Manorial court rolls for Marden, Clehonger and Eggleton, 1280–1

supportDesc.extent: One membrane, presumably formerly a roll. 375 230

msItem.title: Letter of inhibition to Richard Swinfield, bishop of Hereford, from the official of the court of Canterbury, 27 April 1293
msItem.note: Fragment of seal on tag in green wax. Probably relates to the dispute regarding the division of the offerings of wax at the tomb of St Thomas Cantilupe, which bishop Swinfield adjudicated on 29 April 1293; cf. Registrum Ricardi de Swinfeld, ed. W. W. Capes, Canterbury & York Society 6 (1909), pp. 297–9.
Dorse blank except for endorsements.
Document apparently relating to the reform of the statutes of Hereford Cathedral by Matthew Wren, bishop of Hereford, and William Laud, archbishop of Canterbury.

msPart.head: Missing. Described in Hearne's catalogue as court rolls for Hereford, 3, 5, 6, 7, and 12 James I, with material relating to the family of Brome.

msItem.title: Manorial court roll for Marden, Clehonger, Holme Lacy and Eggleton, 1306–7
Manorial court roll for Eggleton, 1324
msItem.note: Dorse blank.

msItem.title: Ordinances for the hospital of St Katherine, Ledbury, 1398
msItem.note: Cf. J. Hillaby, St Katherine's Hospital, Ledbury, c. 1230–1547 (Logaston, 2003), pp. 107–8, drawing on Hereford Dean and Chapter Archives 3333. The present MS. seems to be a corrected draft.
Dorse blank.

msItem.title: Lease, 1622
msItem.note: Lease by Edmund Wrenford, to Frances Pryor, widow, of Woolhope, of the site of the manor of Woolhope, previously leased by the dean and chapter of Hereford to William Pryor of Woolhope.
Fragments of seal in red wax.

msItem.title: Manorial court roll for Eggleton, Clehonger, Holme Lacy ('Hamme'), and Marden, 1308–9
Court roll for Marden, Clehonger, and Eggleton, 1310–11 (?)
‘Great’ charter of King Stephen, 1136
msItem.note: Seal removed c. 1913 and kept as MS. Ch. London 363*.
msItem.bibl: T. Bishop, Scriptores Regis, no. 595 and pl. 5(d).
Text printed by Hearne in the appendix to his edition of William of Newburgh, p. 711, ‘charta...penes me’.

msItem.title: Rental of the canons of Hereford, for parishes in Hereford, Michaelmas 1545
Detecta in a visitation of Hereford Cathedral, 1582
msItem.note: Fol. 36r-v blank.

msItem.title: Bill, depositions and notes relating to dean and chapter of Hereford vs. Sir Edward Fox, knight, concerning lands in the manor of Eggleton.
Obligation, 1629
msItem.note: Eleanor James of Ledbury, widow, and Robert Timms (?) of the same, yeoman, to the dean and chapter of Hereford, for £200.
Fragments of two seals.

msItem.title: Indentured lease, 1629
msItem.note: Lease of the rectory of Ledbury by the dean and chapter of Hereford to Eleanor James of Ledbury, widow.

msItem.rubric: The names of those Tenauntes Copiholders of the manour of Canon Pyon which pay rent Custome rent or worksilver & doe noe servise. Also of those which doe servise and pay noe rent. Also of those which deteyne both rent and servise.

msItem.title: Indentured lease, 1571
msItem.note: Lease by the dean and chapter of Hereford, to Richard Bourchier of Hereford, of the tithes of corn and hay in Tibberton (Worcs.) and 'Moreton'.
Fragment of seal.

msItem.rubric: An aunswer to 4 reasons vsed against D. Shingleton with a replye to certayn aunswers made to his respons
msItem.note: Probably relates to uncertainty about the admission of Thomas Singleton D.D. as residentiary canon in 1604; see Fasti Ecclesiae Anglicanae: Hereford, 1541–1857, pp. 128–9.
Fols. 60r-61v blank.

msItem.title: Manorial court roll for Eggleton, Holme Lacy, and Marden, 1286–7
msItem.note: Dorse blank except for endorsements.

msItem.title: Account for proof corrections, 1676–7
msItem.note: Mentioning 'Rev. Dr. Yates' and 'William Foster'; fol. 63r relates to a Greek Homer and fol. 64r to an English Bible. Fols. 63v, 64v blank, fol. 65v blank except for endorsement.

msItem.title: Manorial court roll for Marden, Eggleton, and Clehonger, 1311–12
Court roll for ‘pallacium Heref.’ (fol. 67r), Bromyard ‘fforren’ (fol. 68r), Whitbourne (fol. 69r), Bishop's Frome (fol. 70r), and Bosbury (fol. 71r), 1644–5
msItem.note: Dorses blank.

msItem.title: Parts of an office for the translation of St Thomas of Canterbury (7 July)
msItem.note: Formerly a pastedown in a binding.
Apparently secular use, but not identical to any of the versions discussed in K. B. Slocum, Liturgies in Honour of Thomas Becket (2004).
Corresponds with the end of lectio 5 in the Sarum breviary.

msItem.incipit: Christe ihesu per thome vulnera que nost ligauit relaxa scelera
Per te thomas post leue munera amplexetur nos dei dextera
Sathane satellites irrumpentes templum in auditum perpetrant
Hosti pandit ostium hostia futurus et pro domo domini stat in hostes murus
msItem.note: Written at the top of the page, mostly lost by cropping; replacing an earlier antiphon ‘Felix locus felix ecclesia in qua viget memoria . felix terra que dedit presulem’ (deleted, with signe de renvoie).

msItem.incipit: Beatus matir est lapis ille quem reprobauerunt
msItem.note: As lectio 6 in the Sarum breviary, lacking the final sentence.

msItem.incipit: Thome cedunt et pareant omnia pestes morbi mors
Thomas (fol. 72v) mundum repleuit gloria thome mundus prestat
Attendamus eciam quod gloriosus martir a sepultura sua cum gaudio suorum omnium exultacione translatus
Nouis fulget thomas miraculis menbris donat castratos masculis
Mundat lepre conspersos maculis soluit mortis ligatos vinculis
Anno quarto pontificatus piissimi patris honorij papae tercij

supportDesc.support: paper, folded in quarto; watermark indistinct
